newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso closes firm, shuns stocks slide.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso closes firm, shuns stocks slide.

text.p: The Mexican peso closed slightly firmer Monday as an ample supply of dollars in the foreign exchange market warded off the effects of profit taking on the stock market, traders said.
"The exchange rate stayed within a very narrow range all day," a trader said.
"Liquidity from some dealers managed to offset demand for dollars from foreign investors stepping out of the stock market," said another trader.
The Mexican Stock Market's leading IPC index was off 30.64 points, or 0.91 percent, at 3,345.41 when the Mexican foreign exchange market closed.
The 48- and 24-hour peso closed 0.3 centavo firmer at 7.5250/7.5290 and 7.5220/7.5250 per dollar, respectively.
The same-day peso earlier closed down 1.1 centavos at 7.5210/7.5260 to the dollar.
Traders said they felt he peso could be under pressuere Tuesday due to expectations that primary Cetes rates would fall.
